Knowledge.KnowledgeTagDesc: Step1:- ------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceCUID we need to update in SAP MASTER ALLOCATION TABLE.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep2:- ------------------------------- Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceFirst we need to check given sap codes in SAP MASTER ALLOCATION table (to check whether given sap codes are available in CES) by using below query.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT * FROM BPMLDAP.SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION WHERE SAP_CODE IN ()Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep3:- -----------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThen we need to update CUID by using below query.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceUPDATE BPMLDAP.SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION SET CUID=?? WHERE SAP_CODE=??Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep 4: - -------------------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceWe can check the updated CUID by using below query.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT SAP_CODE,CUID FROM BPMLDAP.SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION WHERE SAP_CODE IN ()

Step1:- ------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceWe need to check the given ticket no in VSOL_ISSUE_DETAILS tableNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT * FROM BPMLDAP.VSOL_ISSUE_DETAILS WHERE TICKET_NO=??Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep2:- ------------------------------- Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space We need to check ALLOCATED_TO and FWD_TO_PERSON column.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThat particular user id should be there in these two columns.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceWe need to check LAST_TASK_ID and make it as null.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceUPDATE BPMLDAP.VSOL_ISSUE_DETAILS SET LAST_TASK_ID=?? WHERE TICKET_NO=??;Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceCOMMIT;Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThen login ces portal click on DMS/Bulk uploadNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThen click on IRT BULK uploadNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space(Then last task id will get generated)Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceCES portal url: https://10.209.19.190/CES/Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThen check the LAST_TASK_ID, it will be created.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep3:- -----------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThen login by user?s user id and passwordNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceAnd put the Ticket no and search.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceIt will be visible in My tasksNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space

Step1:- ------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space? We have to take the details from the user.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Whether dunning action (ok or not)Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Next have to check for Attribute 1 Attribute 2 data is present from user side.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space And request should be completed.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Where some issue code are available during TT creation and some data available during closure but both the data should be the same.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep2:- ------------------------------- Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space? First we need to insert the data in to a TBD_MASTER_TABLE based on dunning action (ok/not ok).Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space We should ask user if dunning action yes then we have to insert has ok. Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space If dunning action is No then we need to insert has NOT OK. Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep3:- -----------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space? Next we need to insert in VSOL_MASTER_DATANon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space? Then we need to insert in VSOL_ISSUECODE_CONFIG based on mandatory fields (attribute key -1, attribute key -2, request should be complete, op_name).Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep4: - -------------------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceOnce we insert the issue code then that issue code will be available in TBD_MASTER_TABLE,Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space VSOL_MASTER_DATA and VSOL_ISSUECODE_CONFIG Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space
Knowledge.KnowledgeTagName: Not able to view the sap codes under particular user id
Knowledge.KnowledgeTagDesc: Step1:- ------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceFirst we need to check the given sap codes in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION tableNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT * FROM SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION WHERE SAP_CODE IN ()Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep2:- ------------------------------- Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Check for CAM_L7 user id and check that user id in CES_LDAP_MASTER table.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThat user id should be there in LDAP MASTER TABLE.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceIf the user id is wrong we can check correct user id in process admin portal.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceAnd we need to update correct user id in CAM_L7 column in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION table.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceUPDATE BPMLDAP.SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION SET CAM_L7=?? WHERE SAP_CODE=??Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep3:- -----------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceAnd also we need to check the status in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceIt should be active, it should not be cam lock.
Knowledge.KnowledgeTagName: Not able to view the sap codes under particular user id
Knowledge.KnowledgeTagDesc: Step1:- ------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceFirst we need to check the given sap codes in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION tableNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT * FROM SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION WHERE SAP_CODE IN ()Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep2:- ------------------------------- Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space Check for CAM_L7 user id and check that user id in CES_LDAP_MASTER table.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceThat user id should be there in LDAP MASTER TABLE.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceIf the user id is wrong we can check correct user id in process admin portal.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceAnd we need to update correct user id in CAM_L7 column in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION table.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceUPDATE BPMLDAP.SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION SET CAM_L7=?? WHERE SAP_CODE=??Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep3:- -----------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceAnd also we need to check the status in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceIt should be active, it should not be cam lock.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space

Step1:- ------------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceFirst we need to check the given sap codes are available in ces or not.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT * FROM BPMLDAP.SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION WHERE SAP_CODE IN ()Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep2:- ------------------------------- Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space If the sap codes are not available then we need to insert all the details for the sap code in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION_TABLE by using below query.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceEX:Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Spaceinsert into bpmldap.sap_master_allocation (sap_code,customer_name,group_name ,sfdc_segment,region,collection_segment,status,agency_mapping,cam_l7,cam_l5,cam_l3,cam_l2,cam_l1,recovery_lead,nam,asm,rm,national_sales_head,last_updated_by,cuid,creation_date,cc_segment, dunning_level) values('VS001501','Saha Syndicate Corporation','Saha Syndicate Corporation','SMB','TBD','SMB','Active','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','TBD','KGanapat','null',to_date('9-06-2014,dd-mm-yyyy'),'SMB','SAP');Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceStep3:- -----------------------------------Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceOnce we insert the sap code those sap codes will be available in SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION table.Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-SpaceSELECT * FROM SAP_MASTER_ALLOCATION WHERE SAP_CODE IN ()Non-Break-SpaceNon-Break-Space
As L4 User was Pune , this Issue was occued in user Bucket .
